Implement this method in your app’s initial interface controller and use it to respond to Handoff–related activity. If you do not implement the

method in your app’s extension delegate, WatchKit calls this method on your app’s initial interface controller. (If your app uses a page-based interface, WatchKit calls this method for each interface controller that is part of your initial interface.) Your implementation of this method should look at the
dictionary and decide what actions (if any) to take. For example, an interface controller in a page-based interface might make itself the current page.
The default implementation of this method does nothing. When overriding this method, do not call

abstract.text: Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A collection of methods that manages the app-level behavior of a WatchKit extension.
Responds to Handoff–related activity from complications and notifications.
A class that provides the infrastructure for managing the interface in a watchOS app.
Adds an action to the context menu by using an image provided by your WatchKit extension.
Adds an action to the context menu using a system-provided icon.
Adds an action to the context menu using an existing image resource in your Watch app bundle.
Tells the system that you are about to start a potentially lengthy update task for your glance.
Removes all programmatically added actions from the context menu.
Tells the system that you finished updating your glance content.
Loads the specified interface controllers and rebuilds the app’s page-based interface.
Registers the current user activity with the system.
Template images that you can use for menus.
Keys for retrieving text response information.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
